# FunctionIdentifier

**Structure**

A type that stores the designation code for one of your vehicle’s features.

## Declaration

```swift
struct FunctionIdentifier
```

## Overview

A [doc://com.apple.CarKey/documentation/CarKey/FunctionIdentifier] type wraps a vehicle-specific code you define. This code — known as the function identifier — corresponds to a particular feature of your vehicle. For example, one function identifier might represent the vehicle’s door locks and another represent the vehicle’s window system. Use this type in conjunction with an [doc://com.apple.CarKey/documentation/CarKey/ActionIdentifier] type to specify the complete action you want to perform on a vehicle.

## Creating a Function Identifier

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates and returns a new function identifier with the specified value.
- **init(_:)**: Creates and returns a new function identifier with the specified value.

## Getting the Value

- **rawValue**: The raw value that corresponds to the specific feature of your vehicle.

## Vehicle Actions

- **RemoteKeylessEntryAction**: An automatically ending action that you want to perform on a vehicle.
- **RemoteKeylessEntryEnduringAction**: An action with an optional stopping point that you want to perform on a vehicle.
- **ActionIdentifier**: A type that stores the designation code for one of the actions that a vehicle feature supports.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
